q: News Washington Bureau The Environmental Protection Agency and Chrysler will announce a new research and development project next week in Debbie Stabenow Arbor. EPA Administrator Lisa Jackson will join Chrysler Group CEO Sergio Marchionne to announce a research and development project to explore and evaluate an innovative drivetrain technology for light duty vehicles, the EPA said in a statement. It can safely be said that what Chrysler delivered last year, on both the product and financial fronts, surpassed many expectations, Sergio Marchionne said Monday in a statement. , Kanat Saudabayev exchanged views on prospects of development of the Kazakh-U.S. strategic partnership. Colin Powell said this partnership is based on solid foundations of cooperation in politics, economics, and security and should be strongly encouraged. Kanat Saudabayev briefed Colin Powell on the outcome of Kazakhstan's OSCE chairmanship and the decisions of the Astana summit, the ministry reported. The meeting with Former National Security Adviser Brent Scowcroft discussed the current state and prospects of the nuclear nonproliferation regime, as well as development of nuclear power in the world.
